abstract: An article on Monday about concern on Wall Street and among toy retailers over the commercial potential of “Up,” Pixar Animation Studios’ latest feature, misstated the amount Walt Disney Company paid for Pixar in 2006. It was $7.4 billion, not $9 billion.

lead_paragraph: An article on Monday about concern on Wall Street and among toy retailers over the commercial potential of “Up,” Pixar Animation Studios’ latest feature, misstated the amount Walt Disney Company paid for Pixar in 2006. It was $7.4 billion, not $9 billion.
